placeholder.random.random.Random¶

class placeholder.random.random.Random(resolution='standard', coordinate_type='Euclidean')[source]¶

Class to randomly interpolate by picking values between maximum and minimum measurements.

Note: Even if a point on the requested grid is present in the training set, we return a random value for it.

__init__(self, resolution='standard', coordinate_type='Euclidean')[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

fit(self, X, y)¶

The function call to fit the model on the given data. Parameters ———- X: {array-like, 2D matrix}, shape(n_samples, 2)

The set of all coordinates, where we have ground truth values

y: array-like, shape(n_samples,)

The set of all the ground truth values using which we perform interpolation

selfobject

Returns self

predict(self, x1min, x1max, x2min, x2max)¶

The function call to predict using the interpolated data. Parameters ———- x1min, x1max: float,

Upper and lower bound on x1 dimension for the interpolation.

x2min, x2max: float,

Upper and lower bound on x2 dimension for the interpolation.

Returns
y: array-like, shape(n_samples,)

Interpolated values on the grid requested.
